title: Mental Health Diagnosis from Voice Data Using Convolutional Neural Networks and Vision Transformers
authors: MD Rafiul Islam, Md. Taimur Ahad, Faisal Ahmed, Bo Song, Yan Li
abstract: A hybrid ViTâ€“CNN pipeline for voice-based psychological stability and mental health diagnosis using spectrogram representations. Bengali voice data collected ethically from mental health institutions in Bangladesh is transformed into log-mel spectrograms. The pipeline addresses class imbalance (e.g., SMOTE), applies robust evaluation methodology, and achieves ~91% accuracy with ROC-AUC around 0.97, demonstrating clinically meaningful diagnostic potential.

title: Using Computer Vision for Skin Disease Diagnosis in Bangladesh: Enhancing Interpretability and Transparency in Deep Learning Models for Skin Cancer Classification
abstract: Skin lesion classification with emphasis on interpretability and transparent decision support for the Bangladesh healthcare context. Includes comparative analysis across transfer learning models alongside a computationally efficient model approach, aiming to enhance early detection and provide explainable predictions for clinical adoption.
